qas.question: Who gave Spectre a perfect rating in The Daily Telegraph?
A writer for which publication rated the film 7.2/10?
What score did Mark Kermode give Spectre?
How many stars did Mark Kermode of the Guardian aware Spectre prior to its release?
Spectre received mostly positive reviews prior to its release in what country?
John Kermode from the Guardian, gave the film how many out of five stars?
The Daily Mail's Robbie Collin described the film as what?
GIN's Chris Tully said what about the film?

context: Prior to its <b4_0>UK<b4_0/> release, Spectre mostly received positive reviews. Mark Kermode, writing in The Guardian, gave the film <a2_0><a3_0><b5_0>four<b5_0/> out of five<a3_0/> stars<a2_0/>, observing that the film did not live up to the standard set by Skyfall, but was able to tap into audience expectations. Writing in the same publication, Peter Bradshaw gave the film a full five stars, calling it "inventive, intelligent and complex", and singling out Craig's performance as the film's highlight. In another five star review, The Daily Telegraph's <a0_0>Robbie Collin<a0_0/> described Spectre as "<b6_0>a swaggering show of confidence<b6_0/>'", lauding it as "a feat of pure cinematic necromancy." In an otherwise positive, but overall less enthusiastic review, <a1_0>IGN<a1_0/>'s Chris Tilly considered Spectre "<b7_0>solid if unspectacular<b7_0/>", and gave the film a 7.2 score (out of a possible 10), saying that "the film falls frustratingly short of greatness."
